explanation: with little or no hair on the head
sentence: John started to go bald at an early age.
sentence_gap: John started to go ____ at an early age.

explanation: to change your appearance so that people cannot recognize you; to hide something or change it, so that it cannot be recognized
sentence: He disguised himself by wearing a false beard.
sentence_gap: He _________ himself by wearing a false beard.

explanation: a number of things that have been placed on top of each other
sentence: He arranged the documents in neat piles.
sentence_gap: He arranged the documents in neat _____.

explanation: an animal that is hunted and killed for food by another animal
sentence: A hawk hovered in the air before swooping on its prey.
sentence_gap: A hawk hovered in the air before swooping on its ____.

explanation: a building in which horses are kept
sentence: The horse was led back to its stable.
sentence_gap: The horse was led back to its ______.

explanation: the winner of a game, competition, election, war, etc.
sentence: The victor of the 1960 US presidential election was John F. Kennedy.
sentence_gap: The ______ of the 1960 US presidential election was John F. Kennedy.

explanation: to walk with an effort through something, especially water or mud
sentence: The river was full but we managed to wade across.
sentence_gap: The river was full but we managed to ____ across.
